title: Tornado dataset
text: basic example shows visualize tornado magnitude counts level:
code: library(tornado) library(tidyverse)  ## Histogram example tornados |>    ggplot(aes(x = mag)) +    geom_histogram()

title: Tornado — tornados
text: dataset contains tornadoes characteristics United States 1950-2022.

title: Tornado — tornados
text: data frame 68,693 rows 27 variables. om Tornado number. Effectively ID tornado year. yr Year, 1950-2022. mo Month, 1-12. dy Day month, 1-31. date Date. time Time. tz Canonical tz database timezone. datetime_utc Date time normalized UTC. st Two-letter postal abbreviation state (DC = Washington, DC; PR = Puerto Rico; VI = Virgin Islands). stf State FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) number. mag Magnitude F scale (EF beginning 2007). values estimated (see fc). inj Number injuries. summing state totals, use sn == 1 fat Number fatalities. summing state totals, use sn == 1 loss Estimated property loss information dollars. Prior 1996, values grouped ranges. reported number years maximum range. slat Starting latitude decimal degrees. slon Starting longitude decimal degrees. elat Ending latitude decimal degrees. elon Ending longitude decimal degrees. len Length miles. wid Width yards. ns Number states affected tornado. 1, 2, 3. sn State number row. 1 means row contains entire track information state, 0 means least one entry state tornado (om + yr). f1 FIPS code 1st county. f2 FIPS code 2nd county. f3 FIPS code 3rd county. f4 FIPS code 4th county. fc mag column estimated?
